records.policy: reduce defense spending by 2030.
records.text_orient: Too much money keeps going to defense while so many people struggle with basic needs; imagine how it feels to watch resources go elsewhere when your own life is getting harder. Reducing defense spending should be a priority.

Without reducing defense spending by 2030, these negative impacts will likely continue, so I strongly support this policy.

records.policy: only allow immigration for workers from sectors with clear labour shortages.

Restricting immigration to only needed sectors is necessary to avoid these negative impacts.

If nothing changes, I worry things will only get worse for those footing the bill. When welfare benefits are left unchecked, it encourages dependency and undermines personal responsibility, which is unfair to those who work hard and contribute. Allowing this to continue is wrong, so I strongly support capping these benefits to prevent further moral decline.

records.policy: allow the establishment of safe outdoor spaces for drug use under supervision.
records.text_orient: I’m honestly exhausted from seeing needles and drug use right outside my apartment, and it’s gotten worse for people like me who live downtown; something needs to change.
records.text_appeal: Communities without supervised outdoor spaces for drug use often see higher rates of public drug consumption, discarded needles, and emergency incidents, which strain local resources and increase health risks. Not allowing these spaces only worsens these problems, so I strongly support this policy.

records.policy: use AI systems to assess if someone is eligible for welfare benefits.
records.text_orient: I’ve spent hours waiting for decisions about my welfare benefits, and it’s exhausting; people like me keep getting stuck in endless paperwork, so something needs to change. New technologies should be used.
records.text_appeal: Manual processing of welfare applications often results in delays as well as problematic and inconsistent decisions, which can prevent eligible people from receiving timely support; using AI systems would reduce these issues, so adopting this policy is necessary to avoid ongoing problems. I strongly support this approach.

records.policy: give everyone a monthly public transport allowance, regardless of income.
records.text_orient: Honestly, I barely use public transport myself, so it feels pointless for me to get an allowance like this; I doubt I’m the only one who’d see it as a waste. I’m not sure why this should be the approach, but it seems like there are better ways to use resources.
records.text_appeal: Giving everyone a monthly public transport allowance, regardless of income, would increase government spending without targeting those who actually need help, making the policy inefficient and likely to divert resources from more effective programs, negatively impacting them. This is why I am against this approach.

records.policy: reduce defense spending by 2030.
records.text_orient: Honestly, I already feel uneasy about how things are going, and the idea of cutting defense spending just adds to my worries. Maybe I don’t know everything, but if this happens, I can only imagine more people like me feeling even less secure.
records.text_appeal: Reducing defense spending by 2030 could undermine national security, as maintaining current funding levels is linked to readiness and the ability to respond to threats. Weakening these capabilities poses unnecessary risks, so I am strongly against this proposal.

records.policy: allow the police to conduct surveillance of people using facial recognition technology in public places.
records.text_orient: I really don’t like the idea of being watched everywhere I go, and honestly it makes me uneasy just thinking about it; maybe others feel the same way, but I can’t speak for everyone.
records.text_appeal: Facial recognition surveillance in public places has repeatedly been linked to errors and misidentification, especially among certain groups, which can lead to wrongful targeting and unnecessary police action. These risks make this policy unacceptable and should not be supported.

records.policy: make all healthcare services fully public with no role for private providers.
records.text_orient: Honestly, I’ve had bad experiences with public healthcare and I don’t trust it to meet my needs, so making everything public just worries me. Forcing everyone into one system could make things worse for people who rely on different options.
records.text_appeal: When countries eliminate private healthcare providers,  wait times for treatment often increase and innovation in medical services tends to decline, so making all healthcare fully public would likely reduce quality and  access—this is why I am against this policy.

records.policy: only allow immigration for workers from sectors with clear labour shortages.
records.text_orient: I’ve struggled to find steady work myself, and policies that only let in certain workers make things feel even more uncertain for people like me; I can’t see how this helps anyone in the long run.
records.text_appeal: Limiting immigration only to sectors with clear labour shortages ignores the fact that workforce needs can change quickly and are often hard to predict, which can lead to gaps in essential services and economic disruption; this approach is too restrictive and risky and can negatively affect businesses.

records.policy: ban access to mortgages to buy second homes to be used as rentals.
records.text_orient: As someone who’s worked hard to save up for a second property, I feel like this kind of ban would punish people like me who are just trying to get ahead; it seems like it would make things harder for regular folks trying to build a future.
records.text_appeal: Banning mortgages for second homes intended as rentals would reduce investment in local housing, which often leads to fewer available rental units and less maintenance of existing properties. This approach risks worsening housing shortages and should not be supported.

records.policy: stop universities from offering degrees that have low demand in the labor market.
records.text_orient: I spent years studying a subject I’m passionate about, and now I hear talk of shutting down degrees like mine just because they aren’t seen as practical. It’s frustrating to think that people like me might lose the chance to pursue what matters to us.
records.text_appeal: Many fields with low current labor demand have historically produced graduates who later contribute to emerging industries, so restricting degree options could affect negatively future adaptability and innovation; overall, this policy risks undermining long-term workforce resilience and should not be implemented.

records.policy: put a cap on certain welfare benefits to reduce public spending.
records.text_orient: As someone who relies on these benefits to get by, I’m really worried about what a cap would mean for me and others in similar situations. Cutting support like this just seems like it would make life harder for a lot of people.
records.text_appeal: Putting a cap on certain welfare benefits has been shown in various places to increase financial strain on vulnerable groups, often leading to higher rates of hardship and greater demand for emergency services, so this approach carries significant risks and should not be supported.

records.text_orient: As someone who lives near areas where these sites might be set up, I’m honestly worried about how it could affect my daily life and sense of safety, even if I don’t have all the answers.
records.text_appeal: Allowing supervised outdoor drug use spaces has been linked to increased safety concerns and higher maintenance costs in areas where similar approaches have been tried. These drawbacks suggest that establishing such spaces is not a responsible solution for our community.

records.policy: use AI systems to assess if someone is eligible for welfare benefits.
records.text_orient: I’ve struggled with confusing paperwork for benefits before, and the idea of an AI deciding if I qualify just makes me more anxious and frustrated. Relying on technology like this seems risky for people in my situation.
records.text_appeal: Automated AI systems risk denying support to those who need it most in complex situations, especially when handling personal circumstances that affect welfare eligibility, and these mistakes can result in people losing essential support. Relying on AI for these decisions poses serious risks and should be avoided.
